PROJECTS HANDLED
PROJECT #1:
	Project Title 
	  MSXI - Chrysler Payment Plan (CPP) /Fleet Central Billing System (FCB)

	Client 
	  MSXI 

	Role
	  Oracle PL/SQL Developer

	Environment

	  Windows, Oracle PL/SQL

	Duration 
	  Sep 2018 -  present


PROJECT DESCRIPTION
Chrysler Payment Plan (CPP) is a project in which Chrysler sells the service contract of the vehicles purchased by the customers through dealers. When the customer buys this service contract the amount on this contract is paid in installments by the customer. For every installment an invoice is generated. Billing files are sent to the dealers and a report is sent to the bank.

The customer can do the payment by different modes, like through cheques, credit cards and through Electronic fund transfer (EFT). In this process the deduction of the amount can be done on monthly basis automatically from the customer’s account. There are different websites for dealers and customers, the customer can do the payment online by this website.
Fleet Central Billing System (FCB) In FCB the cars get repair at the service centers anywhere in USA and Canada. The customers have different contracts based on which the service is provided by the Dealers for different fleets. The repairs are loaded into the FCB system through OWS repair load process. The repairs are bifurcated into repair as a service of vehicle or parts repair. The repairs have certain validations, if passed then it’s a valid repair else goes into invalid repair. The users also have an option to REFUSE certain repairs which will cause them to never be invoiced.  

After the repairs are loaded invoices are generated only for valid repairs. Then the statements are generated for the invoices for the fleets and the payments are loaded into the FCB system.

FCB will receive notification of a billing dispute from a fleet via call, letter, or fax against an invoiced repair. Once verified, invalid repairs are placed in dispute status and a credit is created. 

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
· Development and modifications in the process by understanding and collecting business requirements from the client.

· Collaborate with programmers, and designers for the development of database/software programs and applications.
· Creating PL/SQL Packages, Procedures, Functions, Triggers, Views, joins and manipulating complex data sets in Oracle. 
· Manage database changes related to schema, procedures, views, functions, triggers.
· Use SQL*Loader for data migration/conversation. 
· Migrated data from flat files to tables using SQL*Loader in Oracle.
· Responsible for query optimization in the project. 
· Support all day to day activities related to database like data generation and perform VIN load using SQL*Loader data migration scripting and routines to automate day-to-day administrative tasks. 
· Perform monthly activities like NFPP part pricing monthly data load.
· Create and maintain documentation, impact analysis and user manuals.
· Perform meeting with our US/Canada clients, interacting with them and solving their problems.
· Communicating with the clients through mails/calls and resolving the errors/problems that they face in the application and supporting them by providing the resolution for the issue.
Project #2:

	Project Title
	NEWSCLIPS 

	Client 
	LEAR CORPORATION

	Role
	BA

	Duration 


	Feb 2018 – Aug 2018


	
	


PROJECT DESCRIPTION
NewsClips application is designed to generate Newsletter on daily basis for LEAR Corporation. The application is designed in OutSystems technology which fetches the news articles based on the sources and keywords feed into the application. All the news are fetched automatically by using the Google crawler feature and segregated by the Content Manager as per the requirement.
The news is divided into 3 sections:

· LEAR News articles
· Supplier News articles
· Automotive News articles

· Generic News (Covered in Automotive News section)

The news is fetched for the automotive brands and sorted as requested by the client.

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
· Understand the Requirement of the Businesses
· Analyzing, Planning and documentation, making SRS document.
· Collaborate with the development team and making them understand the requirement.
· Implementation and testing the application.
· Also worked in one of the internal project named Netlink Newsroom.
· In Netlink Newsroom project we’ve developed an application in OutSystems platform which generates newsletter for Netlink employees.
Project #3:
	Project Title
	VINPLUS  

	Client 
	CFA(Carfax After Market) 

	Role
	ETL Developer

	Environment

	SSIS, SQL Server, Files (Flat Files)

	Duration 


	Oct 2017 – Jan 2018



PROJECT DESCRIPTION

CFA (Carfax After Market)
CFA process is Service Management System (SMS). That means we get all shops data from Shops owner and provide to customer. To do this we are using our own software that is responsible for data

Extraction from client’s PC to our own server and filter data using over service provide data to customer. 

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES

· Design the SSIS Package for checking files data to our database.
· Working on High Level Design and Data Flow Designs to create package.
· Using various transforms such as Lookup, Derived, OLEDB Command, Sort, Conditional Split, Script                              Component etc.
· Using various tasks such as Script, Execute SQL Task, Data Flow and containers such as For each loop and Sequence containers. 
· Implemented Optimization steps wherever applicable.
· Used parameters inside package for dynamically changing requirements. 
· Tested thoroughly by writing Unit Test cases. 
Project #4:
	Project Title
	THK VIN  

	Client 
	THK Europe and North America 

	Role
	Oracle PL/SQL Developer

	Environment

	Windows, Oracle PL/SQL

	Duration 


	Apr 2016 - Sep 2017



PROJECT DESCRIPTION

THK, Vendor Information Network (VIN) is a global Web-based system with a suite of Applications (Tools) for shared Supply Base Management. VIN is a centralized Purchasing Information System that aids in enhanced decision making and in managing the workflow across the various processes in Purchasing.

VIN is a supplier portal that is designed to facilitate seamless communication between THK Automotive and its suppliers.

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES

· Use different strategies of database development to meet the client functional requirement.                                                   
· Use SQL and PL/SQL programming, developing complex code units.
· Perform data migration/conversation using SQL*Loader. 
· Developing packages, procedures, functions, Triggers, views, materialized views as per the requirement from the business user.
· Responsible for query optimization in the database. 
· Respond to end user inquiries related to the issues that they face in the THK VIN application.

· Perform meeting with our US/EU clients, interacting with them and solving their problems.

· Hosting weekly meetings with our clients and giving status of the tickets that our support team works on in our ongoing project.

Detailed Project Experience   

    

Employer: Tata Consultancy Services   

Client: Retail E-Commerce Company   

Project : Item Maintenance Application    

Role:    Software Engineer   

Summary:   

REC is a Retail project that collects and perform operation on raw data coming from different vendors. 

It collects raw data and using Informatica Power Center converts it into a meaningful information 

about product and all the information then stored into a database that is IMA. So at last, it is available 

to client in form meaning information about product.    

   

Responsibilities:   

   

• Analysing Requirements of client and understanding the logic of program.    

• Creating mappings, worklets, workflows and sessions to flow the data.    

• Writing Shell scripts to process data files    

• Involved in Unit Testing, Integration Testing, and Prod parallel Testing.   

• Monitoring jobs and its failure.   

   

   

Current Employer: Tata Consultancy Services   

Client: Renowned German Chemical and Pharmaceutical Company    

Project: GS Data Hub    

Role:   Senior Software Engineer   

Summary:   

Various sources systems have data from different processes for healthcare domain. 

Pharmaceutical company stores data traditionally into these systems.   

GS Data hub project is developed to store this data into a central data hub and create a 

consolidated data lake for this data. The end purpose of this data hub is creating a reporting 

layer on this data hub, so that client can track and analyse various verticals and its 

performance.   



There are different file formats like tsv, csv, psv  we are getting from these systems.   

Primarily we are using Informatica Developer tool (BDM) to migrate data from these Systems 

to Data Lake in HDFS. Mappings are created in BDM to ingest the data to HDFS.   

Hive tables are created to store the HDFS files data into tables and data filtering and 

preprocessing is done in BDM Mappings to store refined data in Hive tables.   

And further consolidated Layer is created on top of these Table where we implement it 

through Dimensional modelling, various level of joins to derive some meaningful data that we 

can use for reporting layer.   

    

Responsibilities:   

    

• Work with end users, business and IT users to understand, and analyse reporting 

requirements.   

• On the basis of understanding, Creating Mappings in BDM, writing Shell scripts to pre-process 

data files from various sources and creating hive table to store the data from mappings.   

• Checkout the project from GIT Lab and setup the project.   

• As it a Agile project so taking daily client call(scrum) to convey the work progress and issues 

facing.   

• Writing test cases based on the requirements taken from JIRA.  

• Experience Regression testing and SIT.  

• Executing and maintaining test cases in JIRA and ALM respectively.  

  

ACHIEVEMENTS   

     

• Star of the month in 2017 in Sears project.   

• Appreciated by client for hard work and commitment, received “On the spot” Award in 
2018.   

    

HOBBIES                     

• Solving Sudoku   

• Crafting work
